Last night, we hosted an intimate and unforgettable Scarabus whisky tasting at Club Mareva Beirut ‚Äî and what an experience it was.

Set in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere, our guests explored the full depth of Islay‚Äôs smoky soul, guided through a tasting of four distinctive expressions:

  • ü•É Scarabus Specially Selected

  • ü•É Scarabus 10-Year-Old

  • ü•É Scarabus Batch Strength

  • ü•É Scarabus 30-Year-Old (only 272 bottles produced globally)

Scarabus, meaning ‚Äúa rocky place‚Äù in Old Norse, is a bold and mysterious Islay single malt created by Hunter Laing & Co., a respected family-owned independent bottler based in Glasgow. The brand is led by Stewart Laing, a master blender with over 50 years of experience, alongside his sons Andrew and Scott. Scarabus is bottled at their Islay distillery, Ardnahoe,¬†a modern facility that still honors traditional methods.

While the distillate source behind Scarabus remains a closely held secret, the whisky is non-chill filtered, naturally colored, and matured in a selection of refill bourbon, virgin oak, and fresh bourbon casks. The result: classic Islay peat, balanced by sweetness, coastal salinity, and elegant structure.

Club Mareva Beirut has become known for hosting standout cigar and whisky pairing events, evenings where flavor, friendship, and atmosphere come together effortlessly. This Scarabus tasting was no exception. The energy, the curiosity, and the shared appreciation for fine spirits reminded us why we love doing what we do.

We‚Äôre extremely pleased with the success of the evening and incredibly grateful for the continued support from our suppliers, our friends, and our growing community of enthusiasts. These nights wouldn‚Äôt be possible without you.

Special thanks to Kenny Abi Chedid for masterfully leading the session and to Mag Demian for capturing the spirit of the night so beautifully through his lens.

Until the next pour!
